info_game_structure_parent.note: The overflow CSS declaration means anything larger than this widget won't be visible.

info_game_structure_asset.note: Make sure to set movable and movableInEdit to false so you can drag around the whole icon.

info_game_structure_icon.note: The pointer-events CSS declaration means it won't stand in the way of the item under it but you also can't select it by clicking on it so you have to find it in the tree. Make sure the z here is greater than the z on the item you're enlarging.

wufp1.text: Place tiles onto any empty (tan) spaces.

wufp2.text: Color groups MUST have at least 3 tiles to score.

wufp3.text: Game ends after turn where all empty clusters smaller than 3.

info.name: Creation
info.attribution: The game layout, cards, and library image were created by an anonymous person who gave the work to virtualtabletop.io. Virtualtabletop.io releases all of this to the Public Domain under CC0.
info.ruleText:
NOTE: This implementation is similar to Genesis, but not identical. This is played with a variant where the dice are not used. All rules for playing the game and with this implementation are explained below.

COMPONENTS
Each player has 52 tiles, 13 each of four colors. Each tile shows the player's chosen icon.

SETUP
After all players are seated, click the "Setup" button. Each player's 52 tiles will be shuffled into their own face-down stacks offscreen, and then they draw 2 tiles that only they can see in the bottom left corner.

If only two players are seated, then the smaller board will appear on screen.

ON YOUR TURN
Choose one option:
  • Place each of your two tiles face-up onto the board. 
  • Click the button next to your tiles and select any color tile to draw into your hand. Your previous two tiles will be shuffled back into your stack, and you only place your one chosen tile.
Each tile must be placed on any empty tan space.

Once all your tiles are placed, click the end turn button to the left of your name. You will automatically draw 2 random tiles from your stack. Then the next player takes their turn.

HOW THE GAME ENDS
The game ends immediately after any player's turn if there are no groups of adjacent tan (empty) spaces that consist of 3 or more spaces.

SCORING All scoring happens once the game is over. This implementation will not automatically perform any scoring, you must use the buttons under your name to increase your score manually.

IMPORTANT: Each cluster of 3 or more same-colored tiles is called a Color Group. Any tiles not within a Color Group can be eliminated by clicking on them to turn them over.

Score each Color Group individually, and flip all scored tiles over by clicking on them. For a detailed scoring example, click on the "View Scoring Example" button in the bottom-right corner.

Color Group Scoring
Each Color Group will have one or more player Player Groups within it. A Player Group is any number of orthogonally adjacent tiles that share the same player icon. A player may have multiple separate Player Groups within the same Color Group.

The largest Player Group within a Color Group gains 4 points, and the second largest gains 2 points. 
    • If there is only one Player Group in a Color Group (because all tiles in that Color group have the same icon) then that player gains 6 points.
    • If there is a tie for the largest Player Group, then evenly split 6 points among the Player Groups, rounding down. There will be no second largest scoring for that Color Group.
    • If there is a tie for the second largest Player Group, then evenly split 2 points among the tied Player Groups, rounding down.
Large Color Group Multipliers
Up to 4 Color groups will multiply their scored points depending on their size:
    • The single largest Color Group is worth 3x points. This means its largest Player Group gains 12 points, and its second largest gains 6 points. If there is a tie for the largest Color Group, then ignore this 3x multiplier, and the tied Color Groups may still qualify for the 2x multiplier explained next.
    • The single largest Color Group for each Color is worth 2x points. This means its largest Player Group gains 8 points, its second largest gains 4 points. If there is a tie for the largest Color Group for a color, then ignore this multiplier and all Color Groups of that color will score as normal.
After scoring every Color Group, the player with the most points wins! If there is a tie, then the tied players share the victory.
info.helpText:
CHOOSING YOUR ANIMAL
You can change your animal icon at any time by clicking on your name, selecting your preferred animal, and then click "go". 

ALERT SETTINGS
At the start of your turn you will hear a soft sound and see a text alert on screen. Clicking anywhere on the screen will remove the text alert. If you dodo not want to hear the sound and/or see the text alert when it is your turn, click the "Turn Settings" button in the bottom left corner and change your preferences.
